definition: heaven falls and earth rends (idiom); rocked by a major disaster/fig. violent revolution/major social upheaval
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: Maybe I had been fired at the perfect time, right before everything fell apart.
sentences.chinese: 也许我被解雇得正是时候，刚好赶在天崩地裂之前。

sentences.english: Leonard:Oh, we tried kissing, but the earth didn't move.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我们试着接吻，但没有天崩地裂。

sentences.english: Come hell or high water, I'll be here waiting for you.
sentences.chinese: 就算天崩地裂，我也会在这里等着你。

sentences.english: Although sad always be hard to avoid, but do not feel the day is cracked dyingly accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 即使伤心总是难免的，但不要因此觉得天崩地裂。

sentences.english: I love you dynamic, lose your earth shattering.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你轰轰烈烈，失去你天崩地裂。

sentences.english: To straighten the backbone of our nation, let it earth shattering , I am self-stays on.
sentences.chinese: 挺起我们民族的脊梁，任它天崩地裂，我自岿然不动。

sentences.english: Even if the sky were to fall, I would still love you forever.
sentences.chinese: 即使天崩地裂，我爱你的心不变。

definition: the earth quaked, the mountains shook (idiom); a tremendous battle
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
lit. to topple the mountains and overturn the seas (idiom); earth-shattering/fig. gigantic/of spectacular significance
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
